entry.title: Multi-console Online Retro Emulator Plaform
entry.content:
• Description
  • Code

Description

This web application allows users to play several titles which belong to retro consoles.

At the moment, the following consoles are supported:

  • NES
  • Gameboy
  • Gameboy Color
  • Gameboy Advance

The platform automatically detects uploaded ROMs and crawls Nintendo Wikia for title information.

This page is a WIP! Expect to see some updates soon!

Code

All developed code can be found here.
entry.summary: Upload your NES/GB/GBC/GBA ROMs and play them in your browser!

entry.title: Balancing a Sphere Using a Mobile Device

link.title: Balancing a Sphere Using a Mobile Device

entry.content:
• Description
  • Code

Description

Simple demonstration which enables you to control 3D elements using your mobile phone or tablet.

The live simulation becomes available at a web endpoint of your choice.

It mimics the movements you apply to your mobile device and challenges you to keep a sphere balanced on a horizontal plane.

Rudimentary physics and collision detection are used to simulate the interaction of the involved elements.

This small project represents my first contact with both WebGL, node.js and WebSockets.

This page is a WIP! Expect to see some updates soon!

Code

All developed code can be found here.
entry.summary: Using a mobile phone or tablet to control 3D elements at a web endpoint of your choice.

entry.title: Secure Message Service with End-to-End Encryption and Smartcard Support

link.title: Secure Message Service with End-to-End Encryption and Smartcard Support

entry.content:
• Description
  • Code

Description

Python-based message service featuring end-to-end encryption.

In this message service, all users authenticate themselves using their Portuguese Citizen Card. This service uses ECDHE for key exchanges, AES for message ciphering and the PSS signature scheme.

The system as a whole has been designed to enable the following features:

  • Message authentication, confidentiality, and integrity.
  • Forward and backward secrecy.
  • Identity preservation.
  • Destination validation.
  • Support for cipherspec negotiation.
  • Conversation and participant consistency.
  • Implementation of an information flow policy (Bell-LaPadula).

This page is a WIP! Expect to see some updates soon!

Code

All developed code can be found here.
entry.summary: Featuring ECDHE key exchange, AES encryption and PSS signatures.

entry.title: Detecting and Decoding QR Codes using OpenCV

link.title: Detecting and Decoding QR Codes using OpenCV

entry.content:
• Description
  • Code

Description

My first contact with OpenCV.

This tool captures frames from a locally connected webcam and proceeds to detect and decode any present QR code.

Although 40 different versions of QR codes currently exist, this application focuses in decoding one of the most common versions (25x25). All mask patterns are supported.

This page is a WIP! Expect to see some updates soon!

Code

All developed code can be found here.
entry.summary: The process of reading a QR code in my first contact with OpenCV.
